description: Tracks new designer metadata to be submitted as PR to google/fonts

enrichments.name: Astigmatic
enrichments.bio_html:
Astigmatic is a type foundry run by Brian J. Bonislawsky, a prolific American type designer. Based in the United States, Brian has designed hundreds of fonts spanning a wide range of styles including scripts, display faces, and decorative typefaces.

His work is known for its creativity and versatility, with many of his designs available on Google Fonts. Notable typefaces include Yellowtail, Pacifico, Kaushan Script, Lobster Two, and various display fonts like Creepster and Butcherman.

enrichments.name: Anton Koovit
enrichments.bio_html:
Anton Koovit is an Estonian type designer based in Tallinn, and the founder of the type foundry Tipo (formerly known as exljbris Font Foundry). He studied at the renowned Type and Media program at KABK (Royal Academy of Art) in The Hague, Netherlands.

Koovit is known for designing highly successful typeface families including Museo, Museo Sans, Calluna, and Calluna Sans. His work is characterized by a balance between functionality and distinctive personality, making his fonts popular choices for both text and display purposes.

enrichments.name: Alexey Kryukov
enrichments.bio_html:
Alexey Kryukov is a Russian philologist and type designer based in Moscow, affiliated with Moscow State University. He specializes in creating multilingual fonts for classical and historical texts, with particular expertise in Latin, Greek (including polytonic), and Cyrillic scripts.

His work focuses on reviving historical typeface styles, especially the "Modern" (classicist) serif style popular in late 19th and early 20th century printing. His fonts are designed primarily for philologists, classicists, germanists, and slavists who work with scholarly texts and historical documents.

enrichments.name: Julieta Ulanovsky
enrichments.bio_html:
Julieta Ulanovsky is an Argentine type designer based in Buenos Aires. She began designing the Montserrat typeface in 2010 while a post-graduate student of typeface design at FADU, University of Buenos Aires. In 2011, she launched Montserrat as a Kickstarter project to fund its first public release.

The typeface was inspired by the old posters and signs in the traditional Montserrat neighborhood of Buenos Aires, aiming to rescue the beauty of urban typography from the first half of the twentieth century. Since its release on Google Fonts, Montserrat has become one of the most popular open-source typefaces, with over 1,700 stars on GitHub. Julieta has collaborated with numerous designers to expand the family, including Ale Paul, Jacques Le Bailly, Juan Pablo del Peral, and Sol Matas.

enrichments.name: Christian Robertson
enrichments.bio_html:
Christian Robertson is a type designer and visual designer based in the San Francisco Bay Area who works at Google. He is best known for creating Roboto, the default font family for Android and a core part of Google's Material Design system. Robertson joined Google in 2011 and has been instrumental in developing the typographic identity across Android and various Google products.

In addition to Roboto, Robertson has designed other notable typefaces including Roboto Slab, Roboto Mono, and Roboto Flex, a variable font version. Before joining Google, he created the Ubuntu font family for Canonical Ltd. His work focuses on creating highly legible typefaces optimized for digital screens and user interfaces.

enrichments.name: Matt McInerney
enrichments.bio_html:
Matt McInerney is a type designer and graphic designer based in the United States. He is a co-founder of The League of Moveable Type, one of the first open-source type foundries that provides high-quality, free fonts to the design community.

McInerney is known for his work on popular open-source typefaces and has contributed significantly to making quality typography accessible to designers worldwide. He studied at Tyler School of Art and has worked in both print and digital design.

enrichments.name: Mark Simonson
enrichments.bio_html:
Mark Simonson is an American type designer and graphic designer based in Saint Paul, Minnesota. He began his career as a graphic designer in the 1970s and transitioned into type design in the 1990s. He is known for his expertise in identifying typefaces and has written extensively about typography, including his popular 'Typecasting' series on his blog where he identifies fonts used in films and television.

Simonson runs Mark Simonson Studio, an independent type foundry established in 1999. His typefaces are characterized by their versatility and careful craftsmanship, drawing inspiration from historical sources while addressing contemporary design needs.

enrichments.name: Pablo Impallari
enrichments.bio_html:
Pablo Impallari is a type designer based in Rosario, Argentina, known for his motto "For the Love of Letters!" He is an active contributor to the open-source typography community and has designed numerous widely-used typefaces.

Impallari maintains a strong presence in the font design community with over 26 open-source font repositories on GitHub. He maintains popular tools for font testing and development.

enrichments.name: Adèle Antignac
enrichments.bio_html:
Adèle Antignac is a French type designer who has worked with Production Type, a Paris-based digital type foundry. She studied type design and has contributed to various typeface projects during her time at the foundry.

She is credited as a co-designer of Spectral, an open-source serif typeface commissioned by Google and designed in collaboration with Production Type. The Spectral family was designed specifically for screen reading and text-rich environments.

enrichments.name: Victor Gaultney
enrichments.bio_html:
Victor Gaultney is a Senior Font Designer at SIL International, a faith-based nonprofit organization focused on language development and documentation. He holds an MA in Typeface Design from the University of Reading (UK), one of the world's premier programs for type design education.

At SIL, Gaultney leads the development of open-source fonts designed to support the world's writing systems, with particular emphasis on lesser-resourced languages. His work focuses on creating high-quality typefaces that meet the typographic needs of diverse linguistic communities worldwide.

enrichments.name: Font Diner
enrichments.bio_html:
Font Diner is a type foundry founded by Stuart Sandler in the late 1990s. The foundry specializes in retro, vintage, and nostalgic typefaces inspired by American pop culture from the 1930s through 1960s, including diner signage, mid-century advertising, googie architecture, and Americana aesthetics.

Stuart Sandler is a prolific type designer who has created hundreds of display fonts capturing the spirit of classic American design. His work evokes the charm of vintage signage, menus, and advertisements, making Font Diner's typefaces popular choices for projects requiring a nostalgic or retro feel.

enrichments.name: Georg Mayr-Duffner
enrichments.bio_html:
Georg Mayr-Duffner is an Austrian type designer and open-source contributor based in Vienna. He is affiliated with WU Vienna University of Economics and Business, where he is associated with the university library.

He is best known for creating EB Garamond, an acclaimed open-source digitization of Claude Garamont's typeface designs based on the 1592 Egenolff-Berner specimen. The project aims to bring Renaissance typography into the digital age with support for extended Latin, Greek, and Cyrillic scripts. His work on EB Garamond has earned significant recognition in the open-source community.

enrichments.name: Frode Helland
enrichments.bio_html:
Frode Helland is a Norwegian type designer and the founder of Monokrom, an independent type foundry based in Norway. He studied at the Type and Media program at the Royal Academy of Art (KABK) in The Hague, Netherlands, one of the most prestigious type design programs in the world.

Helland has been an influential figure in the Scandinavian type design scene, creating typefaces that often draw inspiration from Nordic design traditions while maintaining contemporary functionality. Through Monokrom, he has released numerous retail and custom typefaces used internationally.

enrichments.name: Paul D. Hunt
enrichments.bio_html:
Paul D. Hunt is an American type designer who worked at Adobe as a typeface designer from 2008 to 2022. He is best known for designing the Source family of typefaces, Adobe's first open-source type family, which includes Source Sans Pro (released in 2012), Source Serif Pro, and Source Code Pro.

Hunt studied at the Rochester Institute of Technology, where he earned an MFA in Computer Graphics Design. Before joining Adobe, he worked at The Font Bureau. His work on the Source family has been highly influential in establishing high-quality open-source typefaces for user interface and coding applications.

enrichments.name: Dan Rhatigan
enrichments.bio_html:
Dan Rhatigan is a type industry veteran who served as Senior Manager of Type at Adobe, where he led the Adobe Type team and oversaw Adobe Fonts (formerly Typekit). His work at Adobe focused on expanding the type library and improving font technology and accessibility.

Prior to Adobe, Rhatigan worked at Monotype and has been involved in various aspects of type production, education, and advocacy throughout his career. He is known for his contributions to typographic literacy and has spoken at numerous typography conferences worldwide.

enrichments.name: Barry Schwartz
enrichments.bio_html:
Barry Schwartz is an American type designer and the founder of The League of Moveable Type, one of the first open-source type foundries dedicated to creating high-quality free fonts. He has been a significant contributor to the open-source typography movement since the late 2000s.

Schwartz specializes in reviving classic typefaces, meticulously recreating historical designs for modern digital use. His work includes revivals of designs by Frederic Goudy, Rudolf Ruzicka, and other masters of early 20th century typography.

enrichments.name: Alejandro Inler
enrichments.bio_html:
Alejandro Inler is a type designer known for creating display typefaces with distinctive personality. His work includes the Elsie family, a serif typeface inspired by feminine energy that combines the strength of Bodoni with the softness of italics, developed in conjunction with Ana Sanfelippo.

He also designed Wendy One, a sans serif display font loosely inspired by the STABILO logotype, created in collaboration with Julieta Ulanovsky. His fonts have been available on Google Fonts since 2012.

enrichments.name: Ralph du Carrois
enrichments.bio_html:
Ralph du Carrois is a German type designer and the founder of Carrois Type Design (now bBox Type GmbH), a type foundry based in Berlin. He is best known for designing Fira Sans and Fira Mono, which were originally commissioned by Mozilla for their Firefox OS project.

Du Carrois studied at the University of Applied Sciences in Berlin (HTW Berlin) and has been active in the type design community for many years. Carrois Type Design has produced numerous typefaces for both corporate clients and open-source projects, contributing significantly to the open-source font ecosystem through collaborations with Google Fonts.

enrichments.name: Carrois and Edenspiekermann
enrichments.bio_html:
Carrois and Edenspiekermann was a collaboration between two German design studios that worked together on typeface design projects from 2012 to 2015. Carrois, founded by Ralph du Carrois (now bBox Type GmbH), is a type design studio specializing in corporate typography. Edenspiekermann AG was an international design agency founded by legendary typographer Erik Spiekermann.

The collaboration is best known for creating Fira Sans, the typeface family commissioned by Mozilla for Firefox OS. The partnership combined Carrois's technical expertise in type design with Edenspiekermann's brand design capabilities.

enrichments.name: Dave Crossland
enrichments.bio_html:
Dave Crossland is a type designer and open-source fonts advocate who works at Google Fonts. He is based in Denver, Colorado. Crossland completed his MA in Typeface Design (MATD) at the University of Reading in 2008, where his dissertation focused on "The Free Font Movement."

He is the original designer of Cantarell, a humanist sans-serif typeface that was added to Google Fonts in 2010 and became the default user interface font for GNOME. At Google, he has been a major contributor to the Google Fonts project with over 890 contributions to the repository.

enrichments.name: LatinoType
enrichments.bio_html:
LatinoType (Latinotype Limitada) is a Chilean type foundry known for creating display typefaces, many of which are available on Google Fonts. The foundry has contributed numerous fonts to the Google Fonts library since 2011.

Individual typefaces are often attributed to specific designers like Miguel Hernandez while being produced under the LatinoType umbrella. The foundry specializes in display and decorative typefaces with Latin flair.

enrichments.name: James Grieshaber
enrichments.bio_html:
James Grieshaber is an American type designer and the founder of Typeco, a type foundry based in the United States. He has been active in the type design industry for several decades, creating both display and text typefaces.

His work includes the notable Mostra typeface family, which draws inspiration from Italian Art Deco lettering and has been widely used in commercial and editorial applications. He is known for his craftsmanship and attention to historical lettering styles.

enrichments.name: Kimberly Geswein
enrichments.bio_html:
Kimberly Geswein is an American font designer specializing in handwritten and hand-drawn typefaces. She is a former elementary school teacher from North Carolina who began creating fonts as a hobby and turned it into a successful career. Her fonts are based on real handwriting samples, often from students, friends, and family members.

With over 500 fonts to her credit, Kimberly's work is widely used in education, crafts, scrapbooking, and creative projects. Her fonts are known for their friendly, approachable character and excellent legibility. She has 22 fonts available on Google Fonts.

enrichments.name: Sebastian Kosch
enrichments.bio_html:
Sebastian Kosch is a type designer and software developer based in Vancouver. He is best known for creating Crimson, an open-source serif typeface family released in 2010, when high-quality open-source text fonts were limited.

The Crimson typeface draws inspiration from classical typography, particularly the work of designers like Jan Tschichold and Robert Slimbach. In 2018, Crimson Pro was released as a professionally redesigned version by Jacques Le Bailly, commissioned by Google.

enrichments.name: Juan Pablo del Peral
enrichments.bio_html:
Juan Pablo del Peral is an Argentine type designer based in Buenos Aires, Argentina. He specializes in calligraphic and display typefaces with historical influences, drawing inspiration from medieval manuscripts and traditional lettering styles.

Del Peral is best known for creating Almendra, a calligraphic typeface family inspired by the chancery style of medieval manuscripts. He has also collaborated with other notable Latin American type designers, including work on the Montserrat typeface family with Julieta Ulanovsky.

enrichments.name: Friedrich Althausen
enrichments.bio_html:
Friedrich Althausen is a German typeface designer based in Germany. He studied at Bauhaus University Weimar, where he created Vollkorn as his first type design project. First published in 2005 under a Creative Commons license, Vollkorn was one of the first twenty fonts featured when Google Fonts launched in 2010.

Vollkorn (German for "wholemeal") is described as a quiet, modest text face for "bread and butter use," with dark, meaty serifs and a bouncing, healthy look. The font supports over 2000 glyphs across Latin, Cyrillic, and Greek scripts.

enrichments.name: Daniel Johnson
enrichments.bio_html:
Daniel Johnson is a type designer based in High Point, North Carolina. He specializes in creating fonts for literacy efforts, with particular focus on African languages and Latin-derived alphabets.

His fonts are known for their clarity and extensive character support, including coverage for multiple writing systems such as Cyrillic, Greek, and Vietnamese. Johnson's work emphasizes legibility and proper diacritical mark placement, making his typefaces well-suited for educational and multilingual applications.

enrichments.name: Andrey V. Panov
enrichments.bio_html:
Andrey V. Panov is a Russian type designer affiliated with the Institute of Automation and Control Processes (IACP) at the Far Eastern Branch of the Russian Academy of Sciences in Vladivostok. He has been developing typefaces since at least 2008, working with open-source tools such as FontForge and xgridfit.

He is known for his meticulous approach to font hinting, manually instructing most glyphs for optimal rendering on LCD displays. His work on the Istok typeface evolved significantly into an original design with comprehensive Latin and Cyrillic support.

enrichments.name: Jovanny Lemonad
enrichments.bio_html:
Jovanny Lemonad is a Russian type designer known for creating numerous open-source typefaces with strong support for Cyrillic scripts. His fonts have been included in Google Fonts since 2010, making them freely available worldwide.

Lemonad's work spans various styles including sans-serif, serif, display, and handwriting typefaces. His designs often combine functionality with distinctive character, as seen in fonts like Philosopher (inspired by Agfa Rotis and ITC Binary), the feminine display face Yeseva One (dedicated to his wife, named from the phrase "Yes, Eva"), and the narrow grotesque Cuprum.

enrichments.name: Brian Zick
enrichments.bio_html:
Brian Zick is a type designer who has contributed fonts to Google Fonts. He is known for designing decorative and display typefaces.

His work includes Sevillana, a decorative calligraphic script typeface inspired by Spanish and Latin American lettering traditions.

enrichments.name: Brownfox
enrichments.bio_html:
Brownfox is a type design studio based in Bangkok, Thailand, specializing in creating typefaces with Thai and Latin script support. The foundry focuses on developing high-quality fonts that serve the needs of both Thai and international typography.

Their work is characterized by modern, geometric designs that maintain excellent readability across both Thai and Latin characters. Multiple Brownfox typefaces are available on Google Fonts, making Thai typography more accessible to designers and developers worldwide.

enrichments.name: Claus Eggers Sørensen
enrichments.bio_html:
Claus Eggers Sørensen received his BDes from The Gerrit Rietveld Academie in Amsterdam, The Netherlands, and a Master of Arts in Typeface Design at The Department of Typography & Graphic Communication, The University of Reading.

He has a background in graphic design and commercial art direction. Though of Danish nationality, he is currently living and working in Amsterdam.

enrichments.name: Gesine Todt
enrichments.bio_html: Gesine Todt is a type designer who has contributed to font development projects. She is credited as a contributor to the Nunito typeface family, working alongside Vernon Adams (original designer) and Jacques Le Bailly.

enrichments.name: Haley Fiege
enrichments.bio_html:
Haley Fiege is a Canadian type designer and illustrator based in Montreal. She creates playful, expressive typefaces that often blend illustration with typography, bringing a unique artistic sensibility to font design.

Fiege is best known for her collaboration with artist Shantell Martin on Shantell Sans, a handwriting-inspired variable font released on Google Fonts in 2023. The typeface captures Martin's distinctive drawing style in a functional font family with multiple weights and an italic axis.

enrichments.name: Fernando Díaz
enrichments.bio_html:
Fernando Díaz is a type designer known for creating the Fenix typeface, a serif font added to Google Fonts in September 2012.

Fenix is a serif typeface designed for display and text use, featuring Latin and Latin Extended character support.

enrichments.name: Constanza Artigas
enrichments.bio_html:
Constanza Artigas Preller is a typeface and graphic designer from South America. Her work is characterized by cultural and historical inspirations from Latin American heritage.

She designed Inika in 2011, a serif typeface inspired by Easter Island's Rapa Nui language and culture. The name means "ink" in Rapa Nui. She also co-designed Homenaje with Agustina Mingote, a narrow grotesque sans-serif inspired by bronze cemetery lettering found in Buenos Aires, Argentina.

enrichments.name: Gustavo Dipre
enrichments.bio_html: Gustavo Dipre is a type designer who has contributed to the Google Fonts library. He co-designed Gorditas with Brenda Gallo, a fun and funky display slab serif typeface family featuring heart details.

enrichments.name: Sudtipos
enrichments.bio_html:
Sudtipos is a renowned type foundry based in Buenos Aires, Argentina, founded in 2002. The foundry has become internationally recognized for its distinctive approach to type design, particularly excelling in script, display, and decorative typefaces that often draw inspiration from Latin American lettering traditions, vintage signage, and mid-century design aesthetics.

The foundry was co-founded by Alejandro Paul (Ale Paul), who serves as its principal designer and creative force. Working alongside collaborators including Joluvian, Diego Giaccone, and others, Sudtipos has built an impressive catalog of award-winning typefaces.

enrichments.name: Frank Grießhammer
enrichments.bio_html:
Frank Grießhammer is a German type designer who worked at Adobe as a senior type designer. He is known for his work on the Source Han Sans and Source Han Serif pan-CJK typeface families, massive collaborative projects supporting Chinese, Japanese, and Korean scripts.

Beyond his type design work, Grießhammer has contributed significantly to font tooling and the open-source font development ecosystem. He has been involved in developing tools for font production and has shared his expertise through talks and workshops at typography conferences.

enrichments.name: Vladimir Yefimov
enrichments.bio_html:
Vladimir Yefimov (1949-2012) was a prominent Russian type designer and one of the founders of ParaType, the leading Russian digital type foundry. He was instrumental in developing high-quality Cyrillic typefaces and adapting Western designs for Russian typography.

Yefimov designed numerous original typefaces and supervised the development of many more at ParaType. His work helped establish modern standards for Cyrillic type design and made professional typography accessible to Russian-speaking designers and publishers.

enrichments.name: Monokrom
enrichments.bio_html:
Monokrom is an independent type foundry based in Oslo, Norway, founded by Frode Helland and Sindre Bremnes. The foundry specializes in creating high-quality retail and custom typefaces with a distinctive Scandinavian design sensibility.

Monokrom's typefaces are known for their careful attention to detail, extensive language support, and thoughtful design that balances functionality with character. The foundry has contributed fonts to Google Fonts and works with international clients on custom typography projects.

enrichments.name: Sindre Bremnes
enrichments.bio_html:
Sindre Bremnes is a Norwegian type designer and co-founder of Monokrom, an independent type foundry based in Oslo, Norway. He studied at the Type and Media program at the Royal Academy of Art (KABK) in The Hague, Netherlands.

Together with Frode Helland, Bremnes has helped establish Monokrom as a respected foundry known for carefully crafted typefaces with strong Scandinavian design influences.

enrichments.name: Sandoll
enrichments.bio_html:
Sandoll is a pioneering Korean type foundry founded in 1984, making it one of the oldest and most influential digital type companies in South Korea. The foundry specializes in Korean Hangul typefaces as well as multilingual font families.

Sandoll has played a crucial role in the development of Korean digital typography, creating numerous typefaces used across print, web, and mobile platforms. The foundry continues to innovate in Korean type design while expanding its offerings to support global typography needs.

enrichments.name: Mota Italic
enrichments.bio_html:
Mota Italic is a type foundry run by Rob Keller, focusing on creating distinctive text and display typefaces. The foundry is known for producing carefully crafted fonts with strong personalities and excellent technical quality.

Keller's approach to type design emphasizes both aesthetic appeal and functional performance, resulting in typefaces that work well across various applications from editorial design to branding.

enrichments.name: MADType
enrichments.bio_html:
MADType is a type foundry founded by Matthew Desmond. The foundry has contributed several open-source typefaces to Google Fonts, including display and text faces spanning both serif and sans-serif categories.

Matthew Desmond's fonts, such as Abel (a modern condensed sans-serif) and Quantico (a techno-futuristic design), have been available on Google Fonts since 2011-2012, demonstrating early participation in the open-source web font movement.

enrichments.name: Jasper de Waard
enrichments.bio_html:
Jasper de Waard is a self-taught type designer from Rotterdam, the Netherlands, who runs Bureau Roffa, a boutique type foundry. His fascination with typography began early - he published his first typeface on MyFonts at the age of twelve. After an internship at Dalton Maag, he founded Bureau Roffa.

Beyond type design, Jasper pursues a parallel career in cognitive science. He is currently a PhD student at Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam in the Department of Cognitive Psychology, conducting experimental research on visual attention.

enrichments.name: Jonas Hecksher
enrichments.bio_html:
Jonas Hecksher is a Danish type designer and co-founder of Playtype, a type foundry based in Copenhagen, Denmark. He co-founded Playtype together with Rikke Friis in 2005.

The foundry has become known for both their retail typefaces and custom type design work, with a distinctive Scandinavian aesthetic that combines clean modernism with expressive character.

enrichments.name: Szymon Celej
enrichments.bio_html:
Szymon Celej is a Polish type designer who runs Hypnotype, a type design studio. He specializes in creating contemporary typefaces with strong visual character and has collaborated with established type foundries and designers.

His typeface Doppio One, available on Google Fonts since 2012, is a robust low-contrast sans-serif with a boxy, contemporary feel designed for both screen use and display sizes. The font was mastered in collaboration with Eben Sorkin of Sorkin Type Co.

enrichments.name: Olga Umpeleva
enrichments.bio_html:
Olga Umpeleva is a type designer who has worked with Brownfox, a type design studio. Her typefaces are known for their playful, decorative character with distinctive personalities.

She designed Sevillana, a headline typeface inspired by the handmade ceramic commemorative plates found on house walls in Andalusia, Spain. She also created Henny Penny, an offbeat display font named after the fairy-tale chicken character, featuring a friendly and playful structure.

enrichments.name: Spyros Zevelakis
enrichments.bio_html:
Spyros Zevelakis is a Greek type designer known for creating geometric sans serif typefaces. His work draws inspiration from early 20th century poster lettering and epigraphic Greek monoline letters.

His typefaces Alata and Alatsi, published by Sorkin Type in collaboration with Eben Sorkin, are available on Google Fonts. Both designs feature geometric forms with distinctive contemporary touches.

enrichments.name: Onur Yazıcıgil
enrichments.bio_html:
Onur Yazıcıgil is a Turkish typographer and type designer based in Istanbul. He holds a PhD in Graphic Design with a specialization in Ottoman Typography History from Mimar Sinan Fine Arts University, an MFA in Visual Communication Design from Purdue University (USA), and a BFA in Graphic Design from Bilkent University in Ankara.

He serves as Assistant Professor of Visual Communication Design at Sabanci University in Istanbul. His academic research focuses on Ottoman typography history. He designed Duru Sans, a low-contrast humanist sans-serif typeface available on Google Fonts since 2011.

enrichments.name: Pablo Ugerman
enrichments.bio_html:
Pablo Ugerman is an Argentine type designer who has contributed multiple typefaces to the Google Fonts library. His work spans various styles and includes both Latin and multi-script designs.

He is known for collaborating on typeface projects with other designers, including work on Thai-Latin font families. His fonts demonstrate a commitment to expanding typographic resources for global audiences.

enrichments.name: Martin Sommaruga
enrichments.bio_html:
Martin Sommaruga is a type designer who runs Estudio Trama, a design studio based in South America. He has contributed open-source typefaces to Google Fonts since 2012.

His typeface Rambla is a humanist sans-serif designed for medium-long texts, featuring a slightly condensed design with a generous x-height and economical proportions. Rufina, his serif typeface, combines features of several typographic styles with Bodoni forms found in the calligraphy of flexible tip pens, featuring high contrast that works well in both text and headlines.

enrichments.name: Michal Sahar
enrichments.bio_html:
Michal Sahar (born 1970) is an Israeli type designer, graphic designer, and typographer based in Tel Aviv. She runs her own design studio and is a senior lecturer and head of the Graphic-Typographic track in the Visual Communication Department at Bezalel Academy of Arts and Design, Jerusalem. She is a graduate of Bezalel and co-founder of Hagilda, a cooperative font foundry established in 2002 with Danny Mirav (Hatayas).

Sahar has designed branding and visual identities for major institutions including Bezalel Academy, Tel Aviv Museum of Art, Petach Tikva Museum, and Jaffa Port. She has received numerous awards including the Israeli Ministry of Culture Design Award (2004), ADC Bronze Cube (2012), Granshan 2nd prize for Fedra Hebrew (2015), and TDC Certificate of Typographic Excellence (2017).

enrichments.name: Riccardo De Franceschi
enrichments.bio_html:
Riccardo De Franceschi is an Italian type designer known for creating distinctive display typefaces. He runs RDF Type (rdftype.it) and has collaborated with Sorkin Type Co on several projects for Google Fonts.

His typefaces are characterized by bold, expressive forms well-suited for headlines and display use. Many of his designs feature playful personality and strong visual impact, ranging from the ultra-bold slab serif Gravitas One to the decorative Goblin One and Vampiro One.

enrichments.name: Natalia Raices
enrichments.bio_html:
Natalia Raices is a type designer who has contributed handwriting-style typefaces to Google Fonts since 2011. Her work focuses on creating friendly, approachable display fonts with a handwritten character.

She designed the Delius family, including Delius, Delius Unicase, and Delius Swash Caps. These typefaces feature a casual, hand-lettered aesthetic suitable for informal design applications.

enrichments.name: Linus Romer
enrichments.bio_html:
Linus Romer is a type designer and font developer specializing in font technology and open-source tools for the type design community. He has developed several widely-used utilities for font engineering, including tools for curve manipulation, METAFONT conversion, and font interpolation.

His work focuses on technical aspects of type design, creating plugins for FontForge and developing software that bridges traditional METAFONT technology with modern outline font formats. He has an active presence in the open-source typography community.

enrichments.name: Jos Buivenga
enrichments.bio_html:
Jos Buivenga is a Dutch type designer and founder of exljbris Font Foundry, based in the Netherlands. He began designing typefaces in 2005 and has since become known for creating high-quality fonts, many of which he has released as free fonts.

His work is characterized by elegant, versatile typefaces suitable for both display and text use. Buivenga's fonts have been downloaded millions of times and are widely used in both print and digital design projects worldwide.

enrichments.name: TypeTogether
enrichments.bio_html:
TypeTogether is an indie type foundry established in 2006 by Veronika Burian and José Scaglione. The foundry focuses on creating high-quality typefaces for extended reading and editorial use, with particular attention to multi-script and multi-language support.

Based between Czech Republic and Argentina, TypeTogether has earned recognition for their meticulous approach to type design, winning numerous awards including multiple TDC (Type Directors Club) awards. Their fonts are widely used in editorial design, corporate identity, and digital publishing.

enrichments.name: Eben Sorkin
enrichments.bio_html:
Eben Sorkin is an American type designer based in Shelburne Falls, Massachusetts, and the founder of Sorkin Type Co. His work focuses on creating typefaces optimized for screen readability and extended language support, with particular attention to Latin and Cyrillic scripts.

Sorkin Type Co. maintains over 60 open-source font families, many of which are available through Google Fonts. The foundry has been developing typefaces for over 12 years, with Merriweather being one of the most widely used serif fonts on the web.

enrichments.name: Sora Sagano
enrichments.bio_html:
Sora Sagano is a Japanese type designer and the founder of dotcolon, an independent type foundry based in Japan. The foundry specializes in creating high-quality open-source typefaces released under permissive licenses such as CC0 1.0 Universal and SIL Open Font License.

Sora Sagano's typefaces are known for their clean, modern aesthetic and include both sans-serif and serif designs. The foundry's work has been widely adopted in open-source projects, with Vegur serving as the official font for LibreOffice branding.

enrichments.name: Cadson Demak
enrichments.bio_html:
Cadson Demak is a type foundry based in Thailand specializing in Thai and multilingual typeface design. The foundry has been a major contributor to Google Fonts, creating numerous high-quality Thai typefaces that work harmoniously with Latin scripts. Their work focuses on both traditional looped Thai designs and modern loopless Thai styles.

The foundry is known for their meticulous approach to Thai typography, paying special attention to the legibility of similar-looking Thai characters and the careful positioning of vowels and tone marks. Their fonts are used widely in both digital and print media, with some typefaces like Sarabun being adopted by the Thai government for official documentation.

enrichments.name: Nicole Fally
enrichments.bio_html:
Nicole Fally is a type designer from Austria/Germany. She graduated from the prestigious MA Typeface Design (MATD) program at the University of Reading in 2010, where she designed "Miss Informed" as her thesis typeface.

She has collaborated extensively with Sorkin Type Co (Eben Sorkin) to create display typefaces for Google Fonts. Her work spans a variety of styles including Western-inspired display faces (Rye), Art Deco geometric sans serifs (Limelight), and elegant scripts (Pinyon Script).
